alert.note: Alert for Baker; Bradford; Eastern Alachua; Inland Nassau; Union; Western Alachua; Western Clay; Western Duval (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 30 at 4:56AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Nassau, Bradford, northern Alachua, southeastern Baker, Union, northwestern Clay and southwestern Duval Counties through 515 AM EDT... At 455 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Glen St. Mary to High Springs. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Starke, Lake Butler, Keystone Heights, Raiford, Worthington Spring, Alachua, Macclenny, High Springs, Glen St. Mary and Worthington Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Baker; Bradford; Eastern Alachua; Inland Nassau; Union; Western Alachua; Western Clay; Western Duval
